CTE

Career & Technical Education

  1. Home
  2. /
  3. CTE

About CTE

High school students choose to enroll in CTE program because of the incredible opportunities they provide. Students learn about and use cutting edge equipment and technologies with professional mentors who are deeply connected in their industry. CTE programs prepare students for college and a wide range of high-wage and high demand careers.

Programs

Building Trades

Curious about carpentry, masonry, electrical, and power installation? Dive into building construction and finishing.

Health Occupations

Explore patient care, medical terminology, and pathways into nursing and allied health careers.

Culinary Arts

Want to become a Chef or a Baker? Learn what it takes to thrive in the culinary industry.

Criminal Justice

Interested in police work, investigations, or forensics? Get an introduction to the justice system.

Information Technology

Build skills in hardware, software, networking, and cybersecurity fundamentals.

Automotive Technology

Learn how modern automobiles work—from engines to diagnostics, troubleshooting, and repair.

Aquaculture

Explore raising 20+ species of marine plants and animals—one of the fastest-growing food sectors.

CTE Handbook

Policies, expectations, and resources.

Industry Partners

Local employers and work-based learning.
